name: Workshop «Интернет вещей своими руками, или Наши руки не для скуки»

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
• What we'll do
В рамках встречи GDG Kharkiv-Center приглашаем на workshop «Интернет вещей своими руками, или Наши руки не для скуки»
Во время воркшопа мы будем реализовать настоящее IoT-устройство и пользовательское Android-приложение на платформе DeviceHive. Будем использовать платы с чипом ESP8266 и датчики, чтобы передавать данные в облачный сервис DeviceHive, а Android-телефон будет выступать пользовательским устройством для отображения данных. Для нашего IoT-решения будем использовать готовые модули DeviceHive, которыми и научим пользоваться. Покажем, как собрать простой датчик и написать Android-приложение. Количество мест строго ограничено — максимум 20 человек.
Регистрация обязательна.
Для участия необходимо:
• Ноутбук.
• Девайс с операционной системой Android.
• Переходник microUSB.
• Большим плюсом будут базовые знания какого-либо языка программирования, желательно Java/Python.

Спикеры:
Татьяна Матвиенко,Solutions Architect, DataArt .
Николай Хабаров, Embedded Expert, IoT Expert, DataArt. IoT Google Developer Expert.
Евгений Дубовик, Senior Android Developer. По всем вопросам [masked]

• What to bring
Ноутбук.
• Девайс с операционной системой Android.
• Переходник microUSB.
• Большим плюсом будут базовые знания какого-либо языка программирования, желательно Java/Python.

• Important to know

name: Встреча GDG Kharkiv-Center

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
Приглашаем всех, кому интересна разработка под Android, на встречу GDG Kharkiv-Center.
В программе 2 доклада:
Александр Сергиенко, Senior Android Developer DataArt,
“Flutter 0.1.5 Short look”
Описание доклада:
Много слов сказано по поводу кроссплатформенности и, казалось, не стоит ждать чего-то нового, но Google продолжает развивать это направление. Посмотрим бету их нового инструмента Flutter и насколько его можно использовать в проектах уже сейчас. Рассмотрим несколько подводных камней, несколько айсбергов, дабы не повторить судьбу «Титаника».

Андрий Друк, Android Developer в Readdle., “Introduction to Swift for Android”
Поговорим о:
Кроссплатформенной мобильной разработке;
Swift Android Compiler;
Swift Foundation & GCD;
Swift package manager;
Swift Android Gradle plugin;
Swift Android annotation processoe and codegen;
Unit testing;
Debugging;
Profiling;
Swift blueprint project;

Программа конференции (расписание докладов)
12:45–13:00 Регистрация.
13:00–13:45 Выступление Александра Сергиенко
13:50–14:00 Кофе-брейк
14:00–14:45 Выступление Андрея Друка
14:45 Общение

по всем вопросам: [masked]

name: 2018 Google I/O Extended with GDG Kharkiv-Center @ DataArt

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room

description: Харьковский центр разработки DataArt приглашает в хорошей компании посмотреть и обсудить GDG 2018 I/O Extended

name: Post I/O Tour '18 - Kharkiv

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
#postiotour18
Topic: I/O’18 — Самміт, Хеннессі та всі-всі-всі:
Most important at the Google I/O 2018
1. Main event of the conference
2. Main forecast of the conference
3. The main change in Google

Speaker: Volodymyr Ivanov, GDG Kyiv-Center founder and co-coordinator, Central and East Ukraine GDGroups Mentor. Main interests: community management, the future of computing

Topic: What’s new in Google Cloud and Firebase
Let’s talk about what's new in GCP and Firebase was announced at Google I/O 2018, and also pinpoint some well-known best practices of cost optimizations for Google Cloud.

Speaker: Constantine Mars, GDG Kyiv-Center, Lead Software Engineer @ EPAM Systems. Founder of Mobile Architecture Club. Fan of cloud architectures, functional reactive programming and wearables.

Topic: Unreal Technologies
We’ll talk about all Google’s achievements in AR (and a little bit in VR) field, especially about those had been announced on Google I/O. The target audience is mobile game developers, just because AR is strongly associated with gamedev, but must be interesting for anybody, who likes playing games.

Speaker: Oksana Savenko, GDG Kremenchuk, Co-org of GDG and WTM chapters in Kremenchuk, current student in biomedical systems engineering. Curious about AR/VR techs, AI and Bionics, Sci-Fi fan.

We express thanks to
Techsvit - G Suite and Google Cloud Partner in Ukraine, EU
(https://techsvit.eu)
™Non Stop – energy drink cocktail for active people (http://www.newproducts.ua/nonstopenergy)
And our hoster and information partner - DataArt ( dataart.ua)

So we are inviting you to watch the keynote livestream with GDG Kharkiv-Center and DataArt

name: First WTM Kharkiv-Center meetup
description:
We are pleased to invite you to attend our first Women Techmakers event in Kharkiv with our beautiful speakers:

1. Oksana Savenko: WTM Past, Future and Present
As it is our first event, we'll have a short introduce about what is our community, what was the reason of its appearance and what WTM can propose women on local and global levels.
About speaker: I am currently an undergraduate student at Radiophysics and Biomedical Electronics Department. I know a little bit about everything and a little bit more about Physics, Biology and Data Analysis. Also I'm a big fan of cartoons, games (video/board), and SciFi.

2. Kateryna Sinichkina: React & Redux Best practices
Frontend - so many packages so many options. What to choose? We will exchange our experience, will talk about pain and problem solving. React and Redux, best practices and real corporate usage most of frontend technologies.
About speaker: Software Engineer in Nextiva

3. Daria Chernyshova: Automation = Selenium?
For many people, QA Automation means Selenium, and Selenium means QA Automation. There’s nothing terribly wrong about this statement. Selenium is actually a good tool: it has been a leader in its market area for many years, it is powerful, well-documented, and time-proven. And 99% of beginners’ questions are already answered on Stack Overflow!
But the world of QA Automation is not limited to Selenium. There are so much more tools to discover! Let’s speak of the alternatives we have: what automation-assisted testing is, how we can use REST API, and which UI automation tools are easier to use than Selenium.
About speaker: I am a QA Automation solutions engineer in Techery. For almost 10 years I’ve been doing manual and automated testing. I also read books, translate articles on popular science and talk to rubber ducks.
#WomenTechmakers

name: GDG Kharkiv-Center Meetup at DataArt

venue.name: БЦ Протон

description:
GDG Kharkiv-Center is inviting all to the Meet up.

Speakers:
Eugene Dubovik, Senior Android Developer, Team Lead, DataArt
Topic: Android Apps Performance
The speech will be about performance improvements of the mobile applications and use cases of these improvement.

Oleg Mazhukin, Senior Android Developer, DataArt
Topic: MVI in production
We’ll talk about MVI origins and its advantages and disadvantages compared to other MV* patterns. Also take a look at MVI in production with examples of real solutions.

We express thanks to our general hoster and information partner - DataArt ( dataart.ua)
Regarding all questions please write to: [masked]

name: WTM Kharkiv Center Meetup

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
We are pleased to invite you to attend our Women Techmakers event in Kharkiv with our amazing speakers:
Ekaterina Solomkina, QA Engineer at DataArt.
Has been working as QA engineer at DataArt during the last 5 years. Rich experience in testing different platforms in high-load projects.
Maxim Fesenko, QA Engineer at DataArt
11+ years of overall engineering experience in development and testing based hardware and software, including embedded, web and native applications.
Has been working in DataArt since 2015.

“Testing of zero-latency ETL at user data migration to cloud.”
Ekaterina and Maxim will share their experience in testing migration of 1.5+ mln users from server based system to AWS storage and services. The main challenge of the adventure was to implement on-demand migration without even short time shutting down the system and make it invisible to end users.

Marina Lazurko,QA Automation Engineer at DataArt
Has extensive experience in Web and Native applications automation testing
Testing of mobile applications is challenging by itself: sometimes it takes entire entity for manual test engineers to verify each feature against so many combinations of different devices and mobile operating systems. Being easily integrated and maintained, Appium helps a lot in decreasing time and efforts for testing as well as allows to provide stable tests repeatability.
Marina will share a quick guide to Appium Mobile Automation. We will discuss Appium framework itself, how to start automation, which tools are required and some pitfalls that can occur.
#WomenTechmakers

name: Winter GDG Meetup: VIPER and Graph QL

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
Приглашаем всех на нашу первую февральскую GDG встречу

Alexander Kazmin. Senior iOS developer DataArt.
VIPER. Как разогнаться до 300 км/ч. и не влететь в столб.

Огромное количество статей написано о том, какой VIPER хороший и какой VIPER плохой. Мы же поговорим о том, как VIPER может помочь Вам как команде разработчиков добиться максимальной производительности у свести к минимуму издержки, которые накладывает VIPER.

Владислав Писчиков, Middle iOS Developer

GraphQL through Apollo: интеграция и вредные советы

Многие, вероятно, слышали про GraphQL, но немногим удалось узнать на практике, что же это за зверь. В рамках встречи, мы поговорим о том, что делать, если оказалось, что API проекта написан с использованием GraphQL, разберем основные его достоинства и посмотрим, с какими проблемами может столкнуться разработчик и как их избежать.

name: IWD '19: Distributed team management

venue.name: БЦ Протон, 5 этаж, Conference Room
venue.address_2: вход с улицы Богдана Хмельницкого, надпись " Офисный центр"

description:
Hello everyone, we glad to invite you to our IWD '19 event in Kharkiv.

Topic: IWD '19: Distributed team management: how to avoid fails and get productive dream team

We will talk about:
- Advantages for a company in a distributed development team
- Practical experience in a distributed team management: profits, fails, challenges
- Distributed team: how to make it friendly and productive dream team

Our Speaker: Olga Dzeverina, Project Manager at DataArt.
Manages projects for more than 5 years.
During the career came across various projects, interesting tasks and sometimes difficult clients. There is also an experience in large international companies and managing experience not only in the IT industry. Active participant and speaker of the corporate PM Community.

Language russian :)
